DirectoryNameType.description: Formerly called Internal Directory Name (IDN) Node (IDN_Node). This element has been used historically by the GCMD internally to identify association, responsibility and/or ownership of the dataset, service or supplemental information. Note: This field only occurs in the DIF. When a DIF record is retrieved in the ECHO10 or ISO 19115 formats, this element will not be translated.

ProcessingLevelType.description: This element contains the Processing Level Id and the Processing Level Description

ProcessingLevelDescription.description: Description of the meaning of the Processing Level Id, e.g., the Description for the Level4 Processing Level Id might be 'Model output or results from analyses of lower level data'

Id.description: An identifier indicating the level at which the data in the collection are processed, ranging from Level0 (raw instrument data at full resolution) to Level4 (model output or analysis results).  The value of Processing Level Id is chosen from a controlled vocabulary.

PaleoTemporalCoverageType.description: For paleoclimate or geologic data, PaleoTemporalCoverage is the length of time represented by the data collected. PaleoTemporalCoverage should be used when the data spans time frames earlier than yyyy-mm-dd = 0001-01-01.

ChronostratigraphicUnits.description: Hierarchy of terms indicating units of geologic time, i.e., eon (e.g, Phanerozoic), era (e.g., Cenozoic), period (e.g., Paleogene), epoch (e.g., Oligocene), and stage or age (e.g, Chattian).

StartDate.description: A string indicating the number of years furthest back in time, including units, e.g., 100 Ga.  Units may be Ga (billions of years before present), Ma (millions of years before present), ka (thousands of years before present) or ybp (years before present).

EndDate.description: A string indicating the number of years closest to the present time, including units, e.g., 10 ka.  Units may be Ga (billions of years before present), Ma (millions of years before present), ka (thousands of years before present) or ybp (years before present).

SpatialInformationType.description: This entity stores the reference frame or system from which altitudes (elevations) are measured. The information contains the datum name, distance units and encoding method, which provide the definition for the system. This table also stores the characteristics of the reference frame or system from which depths are measured. The additional information in the table are geometry reference data etc.

SpatialCoverageType.description: Denotes whether the spatial coverage of the collection is horizontal, vertical, horizontal and vertical, orbit, or vertical and orbit.

VerticalSystemDefinitionType.description: The reference frame or system from which altitude or depths are measured. The term 'altitude' is used instead of the common term 'elevation' to conform to the terminology in Federal Information Processing Standards 70-1 and 173. The information contains the datum name, distance units and encoding method, which provide the definition for the system.

DatumName.description: The identification given to the level surface taken as the surface of reference from which measurements are compared.

DistanceUnits.description: The units in which measurements are recorded.

EncodingMethod.description: The means used to encode measurements.

Resolutions.description: The minimum distance possible between two adjacent values, expressed in distance units of measure for the collection.

HorizontalDatumName.description: The identification given to the reference system used for defining the coordinates of points.

EllipsoidName.description: Identification given to established representation of the Earth's shape.

SemiMajorAxis.description: Radius of the equatorial axis of the ellipsoid.

DenominatorOfFlatteningRatio.description: The ratio of the Earth's major axis to the difference between the major and the minor.

GeographicCoordinateUnits.description: Units of measure used for the geodetic latitude and longitude resolution values (e.g., decimal degrees).

LatitudeResolution.description: The minimum difference between two adjacent latitude values in the Geographic Coordinate System,  expressed in Geographic Coordinate Units of measure, expressed as a two-digit decimal number, e.g., 0.01

LongitudeResolution.description: The minimum difference between two adjacent longitude values in the Geographic Coordinate System, expressed in Geographic Coordinate Units of measure, expressed as a two-digit decimal number, e.g., 0.01

GeoReferenceInformation.description: The information provided to register the local system to the Earth (e.g. control points, satellite ephemeral data, and inertial navigation data).

Description.description: A description of the Local Coordinate System and geo-reference information.

CollectionDataTypeEnum.description: This element is used to identify the collection as a Science Quality Collection or as a non-science-quality collection such as a Near Real Time collection. If a collection does not contain this field, it will be assumed to be of science-quality.

SoftwareType.description: General software description such as title, name, doi, authority, etc.

EntryTitle.description: Descriptive formal title, or name, of the software

ShortName.description: The Short Name element contains an abbreviated name of the software

DOI.description: Stores the DOI that identifies the software. A DOI is a persistant identifier that is used to uniquel identify objects

Description.description: Brief description of the purpose of the software. This description is meant to concisely provide users the information needed to quickly understand the relevance and userfulness of the software

FundingSource.description: Formal name(s) of agencies whos funding contributed to the development of the software

Downloads.description: Number of times this version of the software has been downloaded

Publisher.description: Name of the entity responsible for publishing the software

OtherDetails.description: Any citation details not included in other fields

MetadataType.description: General information about the updated time, published time of metadata record and language used in the metadata of this sofware

Updated.description: Date of creation or last updated of the metadata record

Published.description: Date of the first availability of the metadata record

platform.description: Describes the platform on which the associated instrument is contained

instrument.description: Describes the intrument whos data the software was developed to process

InputDataset.description: The dataset or datasets that are valid inputs into the software

OutputDataset.description: The dataset or datasets that are outputs of the software

Documentation.description: Detailed documentation on how to download and install the software

Language.description: The language(s) included in the software

Version.description: Version of language(s) required for successful installation of the software

Memory.description: The memory required to download and install the software

OperatingSystem.description: List of operating systems that the software can be run on

InstallationTime.description: The average or benchmarked time (in minutes) to install the software on an operating system

Dependencies.description: Any additional dependencies, such as third party software or language specific package, that are required to install the software

AdditionalInformation.description: Any additional information that a user may need to install the software

TestDescriptions.description: Description of the test that is being run including such information as the use case being demonstrated and the time it takes to complete

TestInstructions.description: Instructions on how to run and validate any provided benchmark test cases

TestData.description: Local locatation of the data provided for benchmarking tesing of the software

TestDataDescription.description: Describes the data that is being used for the benchmarking test

TestMemory.description: Memory required to run the benchmark test provided

TestRunTimeDescription.description: Description of the time and processing requirements for a sample run of the benchmark test case. Should provide a user a general understanding of the compute time and any additional information needed to successfully run the test case

TestOutputDiskSpace.description: The disk space required to store output from the provided benchmark test provided

URL.description: Location at which the software can be downloaded from

Description.description: Description of the website from which the software can be accessed

Constraints.description: Any resrictions imposed on acccess to the software

URL.description: URL of license that software is released under

Name.description: Name of the license the software is released under

Description.description: Description of the liscense the software is released under

Name.description: The name of the the workflow that utilizes the software being described

Description.description: Brief description of the software workflow. Should provide the overall goal of the workflow as well as brief description of the purpose of each software component

Name.description: The name of the workflow that utilizes the software being described

Description.description: Brief description of the software workflow. Should provide the overall goal of the workflow as well as brief description of the purpose of each software component.

Step.description: Describes the which step in a defined workflow this software presents

Name.description: The name(s) of the variables that are required inputs into the software. A variable is a named set of data that contains the recorded values of a measurement. A variable can also be the output of a model

Description.description: Brief description of the input variable including any relevant scientific or technical content

Name.description: The name(s) of the variables that are required output from the software. A variable is a named set of data that contains the recorded values of a measurement. A variable can also be the input of a model

Description.description: Brief description of the output variable including any relevant scientific or technical content

URL.description: Access URL location for the data

Description.description: Brief description of where the link navigates to and the type of infomation contained. Descriptions should be unique to the link

Assumptions.description: Describes any assumptions make for using the software

Limitations.description: Describes any limitations in using the software. May include technical as well as scientific limitations

Type.description: The type of software (i.e. program, source code, etc)

Provenance.description: Free text content discribing any known bugs or issues of the software

Version.description: The version number or version indicator of the software

ReleaseDate.description: The release date for this version of the software

Description.description: Provides a brief and meaningful description of the software version including how this differes from the previous version

Supersedes.description: The version number or version indicator of the software this version supersedes

SupersededBy.description: The version number or version indicator of the software version this version is superseded by

Roles.description: The contact person's role as related to the software

FirstName.description: The first name of the contact person

MiddleName.description: The middle name of the contact person

LastName.description: The last name of the contact person

Roles.description: The contact group's role as related to the software

RelatedURL.description: Related URLs relevant to contacting the contact person/group
Related URLs relevant to contacting the contact person/group

Value.description: The actual contact mechanism value (email address, etc...)

URL.description: URL that provides access to resources related to the software

Description.description: Brief description of where the link navigates to and the type of information contained. Descriptions should be unique to the link

URLContentType.description: Describes the content of a link

Type.description: Keyword that specifies the content of the link

Subtype.description: Keyword that further specifies the content of the link

size.description: The content size (in bytes) of the representation that is expected to be returned from the URL

language.description: The language of the resource pointed to by the URL

Software.description: General software description such as title, name, doi, authority, etc.

Metadata.description: General information about the updated time, published time of metadata record and language used in the metadata of this sofware

SoftwareDescription.description: Contain detailed data about the software such as input, output variables, datasets and etc.
